Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Class to handle main gameplay logic, such as movement or checking game over status.
Author:
Michael Angara

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    chooseRandomZone()
    Chooses a random zone and sets it to be the current zone.
    int
    isGameOver(int steps)
    Checks for the two game over conditions: running out of pokéballs or reaching 100 steps.
    int
    movement()
    Handles all movement by choosing random values, resulting in an encounter, item picked up, or nothing.

  • Method Details

    • isGameOver

      public int isGameOver(int steps)
      Checks for the two game over conditions: running out of pokéballs or reaching 100 steps.
      Parameters:
      steps - the current number of steps the user has taken
      Returns:
      integer value representing the game over status

    • chooseRandomZone

      public void chooseRandomZone()
      Chooses a random zone and sets it to be the current zone.

    • movement

      public int movement()
      Handles all movement by choosing random values, resulting in an encounter, item picked up, or nothing.
      Returns:
      integer value representing an encounter, item, or none
